intro: Lindsaea colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian lace fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a terrestrial fern characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that give it a lacy appearance. Native to the humid forests of Colombia, it thrives in shaded, moist environments. The plant produces small, greenish spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its fronds. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
